qas.question: Who was the executive vice governor?
How many homes were left without permanent shelter?
Who spoke about the dead and missing people on November 21, 2008?
How many people did Wei Hong say were dead or missing?
How many homes had been rebuilt?
How many houses were still under construction?
How many families were still without permanent homes?

context: Executive vice governor <a0_0><a4_0>Wei Hong<a4_0/><a0_0/> confirmed on November 21, 2008 that more than <a5_0>90,000<a5_0/> people in total were dead or missing in the earthquake. He stated that <a1_0><a6_0>200,000<a6_0/><a1_0/> homes had been rebuilt, and <a7_0>685,000<a7_0/> were under reconstruction, but <a2_0><a8_0>1.94 million<a8_0/><a2_0/> households were still without permanent shelter. <a3_0>1,300<a3_0/> schools had been reconstructed, with initial relocation of 25 townships, including Beichuan and Wenchuan, two of the most devastated areas. The government spent $441 billion on relief and reconstruction efforts.
